RationalPiano.Persistence
Class ConfigurationData

java.lang.Object
  RationalPiano.Persistence.ConfigurationData

public class ConfigurationData
extends java.lang.Object

Holds all configuration parameters needed at the initialization phase. Provides methods to read and write that configuration from/to a human readable text file.

Version:
1.051
Author:
Fabian Ehrentraud
Licence:
Licensed under the Open Software License (OSL 3.0)
Date:
2011-01-29

Constructor Detail

ConfigurationData

public ConfigurationData()
Creates a new ConfigurationData with default settings.

ConfigurationData

public ConfigurationData(java.lang.String fileName)
Creates a new ConfigurationData and trys to load settings from the specified file; non-readable or missing settings are being changed to default ones. If the file doesn't exist, creates a configuration file with standard settings.

Parameters:
fileName - Filename, no path necessary if it's in the same folder as the executable.
Method Detail

saveData

public void saveData(java.lang.String fileName)
              throws java.io.IOException
Saves configuration data to the specified file.

Parameters:
fileName - Filename, no path necessary if it's in the same folder as the executable. Nonexistant subfolders get created automatically.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown if either subfolders couldn't get created or writing to the file failed.

loadData

public void loadData(java.lang.String fileName)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Loads configuration data from the specified file.

Parameters:
fileName - Filename, no path necessary if it's in the same folder as the executable.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown if no file with that relative or absolute file name was found.

parseValue

private void parseValue(java.lang.String line)
Parses a "fieldname = value" pair and sets the field of this object to that value. A line starting with a '#' gets ignored, spaces before don't matter.

Parameters:
line - A pair of the field name and the value separated by a = ; whitespaces at the beginning, the end, or each side of the = are ignored.

setField

private void setField(java.lang.String field,
                      java.lang.String value)
Sets the field of this object to the given value. The method does nothing when either the field does not exist, or the value can't be parsed.

Parameters:
field - Field of this Class to access. Types can be: Boolean, Integer, Float, Double, String, outputModes; no native types! does not work when Class of the type hasn't got the method valueOf().
value - The value to set the given field to.
